full_name: STELS Protocol - Stealth Transactions for DeFi
data_sources: Web search results for stealth address protocols

tech_stack.notes: Technology stack inferred from protocol description and general stealth address implementations. No official technical documentation or GitHub repository found.

privacy_techniques.description: Each transaction is routed to a unique one-time-use address viewable only by sender and receiver
Temporary relay funds and sends transactions on behalf of users, acting like a burner phone used once then discarded
Each transaction generates a unique temporary address ensuring no outside observer can connect transaction history
Real wallet address is never exposed during DeFi interactions
Unlinkable addresses prevent chain analysis firms from connecting transaction history even on public protocols

research_notes.description: STELS Protocol enables users to interact with DeFi protocols like Uniswap while keeping transactions completely hidden. Uses stealth address technology combined with ephemeral relays to ensure privacy without traditional mixers or pools.
research_notes.roadmap_status: Mentioned on website but details not publicly available
research_notes.launch_status: Appears to be early stage or stealth launch

gaps_identified.recommendation: Contact project team via website or social media to obtain official GitHub link
Search for whitepaper, technical docs, or developer documentation
Check Etherscan for deployed contracts or wait for official announcement
Look for team page on website or social media profiles
Without GitHub repo, unable to verify implementation details and security
